item.title: Writing json in C++
item.description: Writing a valid json file looks simple. Except that if the json file contains real world data coming from unknown sources, it might not be that simple. The json format does not support everything that you could expect for numerical values and strings. More specifically, a numerical value involves digits in json. This prevents from having inf or nan serialized in json. Strings preferred encoding is UTF-8 with some restriction.
